com.polarion.platform.spi.security

Interface IAuthenticationSource


  • public interface IAuthenticationSource
    Interface used by the ISecurityService to verify given user credentials.
    Author:
    POLARION SOFTWARE

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Access rights - read-only access.
      static java.lang.String ACCESS_READWRITE
      Access rights - read/write access.
      static java.lang.String NO_ACCESS
      Access rights - no access allowed.

    • Method Detail

      • checkCredentials

        boolean checkCredentials(java.lang.String login,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Checks the given credentials against the physical source of authentication. Returns true if the credentials are valid or false if not.

        Should throw an exception, if the check was not possible due to some problems in interaction with the source (instead of silently returning false).

        Parameters:
        login -
        password -
        Returns:
        true if credentials are OK, false otherwise.

      • synchronizeBackendSecurity

        ISecurityService.IBackendSecuritySynchronizationResult synchronizeBackendSecurity(ISecurityService securityService,
                                                                                  java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> users,
                                                                                  java.util.Collection<IContextId> contexts)
        Synchronizes backend's (i.e. repository's) security with current state.

        Actual behavior is implementation-dependent.

        Parameters:
        securityService - security service (not null)
        users - names of users to be synchronized (not null)
        contexts - ids of contexts to be synchronized (not null)
        Returns:
        result of synchronization (not null)
        Since:
        3.1.1

      • setUserACL

        void setUserACL(java.lang.String path,
                java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String rights)
        Set user ACL.
        Parameters:
        path - repository path
        username - user name
        rights - access rights (one of NO_ACCESS, ACCESS_READ_ONLY or ACCESS_READWRITE)
        Throws:
        GeneralAuthException - may or may not be thrown if user does not exist (depends on implementation)
        Since:
        3.5.0

      • delUserACL

        void delUserACL(java.lang.String path,
                java.lang.String username)
        Delete user ACL.
        Parameters:
        path - repository path
        username - user name
        Throws:
        GeneralAuthException - may or may not be thrown if user or ACL does not exist (depends on implementation)
        Since:
        3.5.0

      • getUserACLRights

        java.lang.String getUserACLRights(java.lang.String path,
                                  java.lang.String username)
        Return access rights for given user ACL.
        Parameters:
        path - repository path
        username - user name
        Returns:
        access rights (one of NO_ACCESS, ACCESS_READ_ONLY or ACCESS_READWRITE) or null if ACL does not exist
        Throws:
        GeneralAuthException - may or may not be thrown if user does not exist (depends on implementation)
        Since:
        3.5.0

        void setGroupACL(java.lang.String path,
                 java.lang.String groupname,
                 java.lang.String rights)
        Set group ACL.
        Parameters:
        path - repository path
        groupname - group name
        rights - access rights (one of NO_ACCESS, ACCESS_READ_ONLY or ACCESS_READWRITE)
        Throws:
        GeneralAuthException - may or may not be thrown if group does not exist (depends on implementation)
        Since:
        3.5.0

      • delGroupACL

                 java.lang.String groupname)
        Delete group ACL.
        Parameters:

        groupname - group name
        Throws:
        GeneralAuthException - may or may not be thrown if group or ACL does not exist (depends on implementation)
        Since:
        3.5.0

        java.lang.String getGroupACLRights(java.lang.String path,
                                   java.lang.String groupname)
        Return access rights for given group ACL.
        Parameters:
        path - repository path
        groupname - group name
        Returns:
        access rights (one of NO_ACCESS, ACCESS_READ_ONLY or ACCESS_READWRITE) or null if ACL does not exist

        GeneralAuthException - may or may not be thrown if group does not exist (depends on implementation)
        Since:
        3.5.0

      • checkExistsAndIsValid

        boolean checkExistsAndIsValid()
        Checks if the underlying configuration exists and is valid and logs the message if not.
        Returns:
        true when the underlying configuration exists and is valid.

      • copyACLRights

        boolean copyACLRights(@NotNull
                      java.lang.String sourcePath,
                      @NotNull
                      java.lang.String destinationPath)
        Copies ACL from source path to destination path. ACL for source path must exist and ACL for destination path must not exist.
        Returns:
        true when the ACL were copied.
        Since:
        3.8.0
